intro: Parishia polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited parishia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release seeds. Parishia polycarpa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
